comment._content: The MC (no citation) is first mentioned in the London Gazette at the beginning of 1918: "Awarded the Military Cross [...] T./Capt. (A./Maj.) Ernest Mortimer Allen, Hamps. R." - Supplement to the London Gazette, 1 January 1918, p. 30: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30450/supplements/30 See also, the sales catalogue for his medals (they apparently sold for £1,000 in 2009): content.yudu.com/Library/A1iejc/OrdersDecorationsand/reso... Result (Lot 611): www.dnw.co.uk/auction-archive/catalogue-archive/results.p... The catalogue says that as a Lieutenant in the 14th Bn, Hampshire Regiment, he served from the 3rd March 1916 on the Western Front and was wounded in the Battle of the Somme. It is possible to trace certain other aspects of Captain Allen's military career from various entries in the London Gazette: “The undermentioned to be actg. Capts. whilst comdg. a Co. :-- […] Temp. Lt. E. M. Allen. 2 Dec. 1916.” – Supplement to the London Gazette, 20 January 1917, p. 812: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29910/supplements/812 “Temp. Lt. E. M. Allen (since apptd. actg. Capt. whilst comdg. a Co.) to be temp. Capt. to complete estabt. 4 Sept. 1916.” – Supplement to the London Gazette, 8 February 1917, p. 1366: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29934/supplements/1366 “Temp. Capt. E. M. Allen to be actg. Maj. While 2nd in comd. of a Bn. 5 Aug. 1917.” – Supplement to the London Gazette, 12 November 1917, p. 11665: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30376/supplements/11665 “Temp. Capt. (actg. Maj.) E. M. Allen to be actg. Lt.-Col. while comdg. a Bn. 7 Oct. 1917 to 20 Oct. 1917, when he reverts to the actg. rank of Maj. while empld. as 2nd in comd.” - Supplement to the London Gazette, 31 January 1918, p. 1514: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30503/supplements/1514 “Temp. Capt. (actg. Maj.) E. M. Allen, M.C., to be temp. Maj. 28 Sept. 1917.” Supplement to the London Gazette, 8 March 1918, p. 3106: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30569/supplements/3106 “Temp. Maj. E. M. Allen, M.C., from a Serv. Bn., to be temp. Maj. 24 Feb. 1918, with seniority 28 Sept. 1917.” - Supplement to the London Gazette, 8 May 1918, p. 5545: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30674/supplements/5545 “Temp. Maj. E. M. Allen, M.C., relinquishes his commission on completion of service, 7 Mar. 1920, and retains the rank of Maj.” – Supplement to the London Gazette, 19 April 1920, p. 4564: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/31869/supplements/4564 "Hampshire R. -- Maj. Ernest Mortimer Allen, M.C., late Serv. Bns., to be Maj., 22nd Mar. 1923, with seniority 20th Aug. 1920." - Supplement to the London Gazette, 8 May 1923: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/32821/pages/3314

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
Death records show Ernest Mortimer Allen was born 25th Oct 1889 and died in Torbay in 1978.

Census and birth records show he was born in Oxford. The son of Hugh James and Catherine Elizabeth Allen.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: On 20th June 1934 he was a passenger aboard the MS Erria bound for Bangkok. His home address was given as 28 Plantation Road, Oxford. He was contracted to land at Port Swettenham (now Port Klang) and his occupation was shown as Planter. His country of intended residence was shown as FMS (Malaysia).
